meanings.definition: A pattern or guide used as a model for making something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a templet to ensure all the pieces were cut to the right size.
meanings.sent2: She traced the design onto the fabric using a templet to create a perfect shape.
meanings.sent3: The templet seemed to have a mind of its own, guiding the hands of the craftsperson effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity blossomed as she used the templet like a magic wand, transforming plain materials into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The templet, like a trusted friend, never failed to show the way to a flawless outcome.

meanings.definition: A stencil or guide for shaping or cutting materials.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully positioned the templet over the canvas before painting the intricate design.
meanings.sent2: Using a templet made the task of cutting out the shapes much easier and precise.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the templet, leaving a trail of paint marks on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved with precision, following the lines of the templet as if it held the secrets of perfect shapes.
meanings.sent5: The templet, like a shadow, faithfully mirrored every curve and angle onto the material.

meanings.definition: A form or mold used in construction or manufacturing.
meanings.sent1: The workers poured molten metal into the templet to create the desired shape.
meanings.sent2: The templet was carefully crafted to ensure each brick fit perfectly in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child used the templet as a hat, pretending to be a construction worker.
meanings.sent4: The templet stood tall and proud, shaping the raw materials into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The templet, like a sculptor's hands, molded the raw material into a work of art.
